alert.note: Alert for Hill County; Northern Blaine County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 2:06AM MST until January 10 at 9:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 5 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations up to two inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...Hill County and Northern Blaine County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 9 AM MST this morning. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from noon today to 5 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Frostbite and hypothermia are possible if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
